```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```
```{r}
uni_data <- read.csv("universities.csv")

data_colnames <- c("rank","sat_avg", "acceptance_rate", "state",
                   "tuition", "overallRank", "institutionalControl")

uni_data <- uni_data[data_colnames]
uni_data
```


```{r}
library(ggplot2)
#plot1
ggplot(uni_data, aes(x = sat_avg, y = acceptance_rate, colour = uni_data$institutionalControl)) +
  geom_jitter() +
  labs(x = "SAT Average", y = "Acceptance Rate", colour = "Institutional Type",
       title = "Distribution of SAT score by Acceptance Rate") 
#plot2
ggplot(uni_data, aes(x = tuition)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 25) + 
  geom_rug() + 
  labs(x = "Tuition", y = "Count",
       title = "Distribution of Tuiton among U.S colleges")

#plot3
ggplot(data = uni_data, aes(x = sat_avg, fill = institutionalControl)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 10)  +
  labs(title = "Proportional stacked bar chart of insitutional type by SAT distribution",
       x = "SAT average", 
       y = "Count",
       fill = "Institutional Type") + 
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")
```


```{r, message = FALSE}
#chorelopath on count of colleges in state level
# chorelopath on child average state sat score
#chorelopath on average tuition in state level

state_borders <- map_data("state") 

#  Load state.x77 data
library(datasets)
state_x77 <- tibble::as_data_frame(state.x77) %>%
  mutate(state = rownames(state.x77)) %>%
  mutate(state = tolower(state))

uni_tuition_state <- uni_data %>% 
  group_by(state) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(state = tolower(state))

#  join state_x77 data to state_borders
state_borders <- state_borders %>%
  left_join(uni_tuition_state, 
            by = c("region" = "state"))

ggplot(state_borders) + 
  geom_polygon(aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group,
                   fill = count), color = "black") + 
  scale_fill_gradient2(low = "green", mid = "lightgrey", 
                         high = "darkred") +
  theme_void() +
  coord_map("polyconic") + 
  labs(
    title = "Child Poverty Rate in the U.S. by State",
    subtitle = "Percent of Children under Poverty Level",
    caption = "U.S. Census Demographic Data",
    fill = "Child Poverty %"
  ) + 
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")

```
